data.title: WAY-FM Completes Portland, Ore. Upgrade
data.meta_description: Until now, listeners to nationally distributed CCM network WAY-FM in Portland, Ore., relied on a Class C1 facility emanating from a tower due east of the metro, toward Hood River. A co-channel FM translator in Forest Park went dark. That problem has just ended, thanks in part to Kalil & Co.
data.text:
PORTLAND, ORE. â€” Until now, local listeners to nationally distributed Christian Contemporary network WAY-FM relied on a Class C1 facility emanating from a tower due east of the metro, toward Hood River.

A co-channel FM translator in Forest Park went dark, causing reception difficulties in such western communities as Beaverton.

That problem has just ended, as the broadcast ministry headed by President/CEO John Scaggs has closed on its acquisition of station most recently leased by Alpha Media.
